page.title: 04The History of Breedon Hall2
page.content: { The Hall has two impressive features, the first being the very big stair case and the other is a huge mirror with a brass frame. The mirror measures approximately 4.5 metres by 3 metres. During the war the boiler room of the Hall was used for keeping prisoners and on V.E.(Victory in Europe) Day the soldiers held parties of celebration there. Near the Hall is a large house called "The Breedon Cafe", which is now a residential house, but used to be a cafe. In the cellars of the house there are paintings on the walls that were done by the prisoners of war during the Second World War.
